oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-23 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 23, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Ford Rush with Ford Rush Jr., the Crook Brothers, the Stacey Sisters, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Crook Brothers; Ford Rush; Ford Rush Jr.; Bashful Brother Oswald
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Little Pal (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces the Crook Brothers -- She'll Be Coming 'Round The Mountain (Crook Brothers) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush and Ford Rush Jr. -- Wait 'Till The Sun Shines, Nellie (Ford Rush, Ford Rush Jr.) -- George D. Hay talks -- Old Joe Clark (cast) -- George D. Hay talks -- Old Joe Clark (cast) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- My Sweetheart Is A Sly Little Miss (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Bashful Brother Oswald -- Cripple Creek (Bashful Brother Oswald banjo) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Crook, Herman; Crook Brothers; Stacey Sisters (Musical group); McGar, Mac; Rush, Ford Jr.
